headline: Stock Market News for Jan 14, 2026
summary: U.S. stocks ended lower on Tuesday, with the S&P 500 and the Dow retreating from their earlier highs, as financial stocks struggled to maintain momentum, following a spate of proposals made by President Donald Trump over the past week.

content.title: Stock Market News for Jan 14, 2026
content.summary: U.S. stocks ended lower on Tuesday, with the S&P 500 and the Dow retreating from their earlier highs, as financial stocks struggled to maintain momentum, following a spate of proposals made by President Donald Trump over the past week.

content.title: Merchants take on banks with Trump’s help
content.summary: Just two weeks in, 2026 is shaping up to be the biggest year in the battle over credit card reform in years.

thumbnail.caption: During a speech to the Detroit Economic Club at the MotorCity Casino Hotel on Jan. 13, 2026, President Donald Trump said his administration will halt federal payments to cities and states with "sanctuary" policies.

headline: Visa crypto chief bets on stablecoin settlement, sees volumes growing
summary: Visa is working to integrate stablecoins into existing payment systems, seeing an opportunity to maintain its market leadership as these tokens gain traction, ​Visa's head of crypto, Cuy Sheffield, told Reuters.  While their circulation has surged, led by El Salvador-based Tether's USDT with around $187 ‌billion tokens in circulation, mainstream merchant acceptance remains limited.  Even if new payments systems are built using the technology behind stablecoins, "you still have to come back and connect to the existing merchant acceptance ecosystem if you want that product to be used," Sheffield said, referring to the current network of sellers that accepts payments.

content.title: Visa crypto chief bets on stablecoin settlement, sees volumes growing
content.summary: Visa is working to integrate stablecoins into existing payment systems, seeing an opportunity to maintain its market leadership as these tokens gain traction, ​Visa's head of crypto, Cuy Sheffield, told Reuters.  While their circulation has surged, led by El Salvador-based Tether's USDT with around $187 ‌billion tokens in circulation, mainstream merchant acceptance remains limited.  Even if new payments systems are built using the technology behind stablecoins, "you still have to come back and connect to the existing merchant acceptance ecosystem if you want that product to be used," Sheffield said, referring to the current network of sellers that accepts payments.

thumbnail.caption: FILE PHOTO: Credit card is seen in front of displayed Visa logo in this illustration

headline: Q: What Could a Credit-Card Rate Cap Mean for Your Wallet?
summary: A: The president didn’t offer any details on how the one-year cap would be enacted, but said he wanted it to begin on Jan. 20.  Credit-card issuers are already pushing back, saying it will hurt the people it is intended to help.  Credit-card interest rates average around 23% and haven’t been below 10% in data going back to 1994.

content.title: Q: What Could a Credit-Card Rate Cap Mean for Your Wallet?
content.summary: A: The president didn’t offer any details on how the one-year cap would be enacted, but said he wanted it to begin on Jan. 20.  Credit-card issuers are already pushing back, saying it will hurt the people it is intended to help.  Credit-card interest rates average around 23% and haven’t been below 10% in data going back to 1994.

headline: These Experts Say Buy Credit Card Stocks Despite Trump's Threats
summary: Analysts at William Blair and Citigroup expressed confidence this week that recent proposals by President Trump to cap credit card interest rates and reform payment networks would have limited long-term impact on credit card stocks.

content.title: These Experts Say Buy Credit Card Stocks Despite Trump's Threats
content.summary: Analysts at William Blair and Citigroup expressed confidence this week that recent proposals by President Trump to cap credit card interest rates and reform payment networks would have limited long-term impact on credit card stocks.
